raw_text:
T in the Park sells out in days
 
 Tickets for Scotland's biggest music festival have sold out in record time, five months before the event is held.
 
 The 12th annual T in the Park festival, which takes place at Balado near Kinross in July, sold out just four days after the line-up was announced. Green Day, the Foo Fighters and Keane are among the acts that had already been lined up to appear at the event. However, the organisers have revealed Scots favourites Travis as well as soulman James Brown will also appear.
 
 Last year tickets sold out 10 weeks before the festival but organisers confirmed that all 130,000 for the two-day event had been sold. Geoff Ellis, CEO of festival organisers Big Day Out Ltd, said this year's event promises to be the best yet. "After last year's sell-out, we did think this year's event would sell slightly earlier, however this is way beyond our expectations," Mr Ellis said.
 
 "We are extremely proud that fans are so excited about T in the Park that they have made absolutely sure that their place at Balado is booked for 2005, and we will deliver one of the greatest events yet for them in July." More than 120 acts will play on eight stages over the weekend of 9 and 10 July. Brit Award winners Keane and The Streets are among the main attractions, while The Killers and dance act The Prodigy are also on the bill. Both Green Day and The Foo Fighters last played at the festival in 2002, the same year Oasis and Basement Jaxx were among the headline acts.

The festival will feature over 120 acts on eight stages, including Green Day, Keane, and Travis. Organisers say this year's event promises to be the best yet, following last year's sell-out in 10 weeks' time.

Acts like Green Day, The Foo Fighters, Keane, Travis and James Brown will perform, with over 120 acts playing across eight stages on July 9th and 10th.

Geoff Ellis predicts this year's event will be the best yet with more than 120 acts playing on eight stages over two days in July 2005.

smollm:1.7b: The summary is concise, preserving key ideas and details from the original text while omitting unnecessary information. It captures the main points of the text without adding or changing them. The summary should be written in a clear and neutral tone, avoiding any opinions or explanations.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this text about T in the Park's performance sold out quickly. First, it says that tickets sold out five months before the event. Then, last year at a similar festival, tickets sold out 10 weeks earlier. So now, they're even quicker. They mention that they have some fans excited because they'll all be booked by July and plan to do something great there in 2005.

I should keep key details like the time it sells out, the fact that it's quick compared to last year, and mention the acts participating this year. I don't need any extra information or explanations, just a clear summary.
</think>

The tickets for T in the Park's 12th annual festival sold out five months before the event held, faster than last year when they were sold out 10 weeks earlier. With several fans already confirmed to attend, the organisers are aiming for a sell-out in July, planning to give fans an unforgettable experience in 2005.
tinyllama:1.1b: Tickets for T in the Park have sold out within days, with over 120 acts set to perform on eight stages across two days at Balado in July. The festival sold out four days after its lineup was announced, and organisers expect that all 130,000 tickets will be gone before summer starts. Expecting fans are described as "extremely proud" of their booking for the event that promises to deliver one of the biggest lineups ever. Acts such as Keane and The Street will perform across two stages on July 9th and 10th, while Brit Award winners Keane and The Killers have also been confirmed for the festival. The Prodigy and Oasis were among the headliners in 2002, but both bands performed at the event last year.
tinydolphin:1.1b: T in the Park has sold out, marking a significant achievement for festival organizers. This year's event will be the best yet, with thousands of eager fans having their names on the line to witness Travis, James Brown, and other notable artists perform. Balado in Kinross, Scotland, will host the star-studded festival from July 9th to 10th, providing an unforgettable experience for attendees.

Some of the main attractions include Green Day, The Foo Fighters, and Keane, along with other popular acts such as Travis and James Brown.

The organisers are confident that the 2005 festival will be the best yet.

The 12th annual festival, held in July at Balado near Kinross, features acts like Green Day, Foo Fighters, Keane, Travis, and James Brown. stablelm2:1.6b: Tickets for T in the Park, Scotland's largest music festival, sold out in just four days after the lineup announcement, with Green Day, Foo Fighters, Keane, Travis, James Brown and more than 15 other acts set to perform. Last year, tickets sold weeks before the event, while this year's promises to be the best yet. Over eight stages, more than 19 acts will play on July 9th and 10th.
granite3.1-dense:2b: T in the Park, Scotland's premier music festival, has experienced an unprecedented early sellout five months prior to its July date at Balado near Kinross. Line-ups include Green Day, Foo Fighters, Keane, Travis, and James Brown, with over 130,000 tickets sold for the two-day event. This year's event promises to surpass last year's record of 10 weeks before selling out, as announced by Big Day Out Ltd CEO Geoff Ellis. The festival will feature more than 120 artists across eight stages, including Keane, The Streets, The Killers, and The Prodigy, showcasing a diverse lineup that also includes Brit Award winners.
reference: Green Day, the Foo Fighters and Keane are among the acts that had already been lined up to appear at the event.Geoff Ellis, CEO of festival organisers Big Day Out Ltd, said this year's event promises to be the best yet.Last year tickets sold out 10 weeks before the festival but organisers confirmed that all 130,000 for the two-day event had been sold.Both Green Day and The Foo Fighters last played at the festival in 2002, the same year Oasis and Basement Jaxx were among the headline acts.The 12th annual T in the Park festival, which takes place at Balado near Kinross in July, sold out just four days after the line-up was announced.
